quest.name: Lord of Crags
journal: Riol is waiting for you to give him your undivided attention.

Riol reveals that the Company of Heroes reached Titan not by fighting their way through the mines of O'Ghomoro, but by using a beastman aetheryte. In this way, they bypassed the kobolds' defenses and traveled to the heart of Titan's sanctuary, aided by an unnamed Sharlayan. Search for the beastman aetheryte in Zelma's Run.

In the absence of Sharlayan technology, Y'shtola must remain behind to amplify the power of the aetheryte in Zelma's Run. At long last, the time has come for you to follow in the footsteps of the Company of Heroes and face the Lord of Crags.

※Challenge the Navel with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the trial's entrance point.

In a moment that shall forever be enshrined in the annals of Eorzean history, you slay the Lord of Crags and spare Limsa Lominsa his terrible vengeance. In the aftermath, you sense a dark, stifling presence watching you. The feeling does not last long, however, and you are left to wonder if it was anything more than the fancy of a weary mind. Just then, Y'shtola appears to teleport you back to the beastman aetheryte, instructing you to rendezvous with her at Camp Bronze Lake.
You return to Camp Bronze Lake to find Y'shtola waiting for you. Ever businesslike, she promptly suggests that the two of you discuss how best to proceed.
objectives: Rendezvous with Y'shtola at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Years ago, when we was weighin' up how to get to Titan, one of our scouts stumbled across this beastman aetheryte, see...

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Eh? What's that look for? Not familiar with 'em?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: He speaks of an unamplified aetheryte which has been claimed by a beast tribe. Lest you wonder, there is no fundamental difference between such aetherytes and those which you have used on countless occasions, Forename.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Ah, well if it ain't the Sharlayan lass. Welcome back.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forgive me for interrupting. I had planned to await your report, but I succumbed to curiosity.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The tunnels beneath O'Ghomoro form a bewildering labyrinth that no outsider has ever fully explored. How the Company of Heroes managed to navigate it is a mystery I have long pondered.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Ha! Give us a bit of credit, love! We weren't daft enough to try goin' in the front.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: The kobolds are always diggin' new tunnels an' fillin' the old ones with traps. One wrong step, an' the next thing you know, ye've got a hundred tonzes o' rock on your noggin. Suicide to even try, see?

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Funny thing was, the kobolds didn't seem to have no trouble findin' their way 'round─an' it was that as got us thinkin'. I mean, U'Ghamaro Mines are like a bleedin' city, ain't they? An' gettin' around in a city that big would be a right pain in the arse if you didn't have an Aethernet, wouldn't it? So it stood to reason that the kobolds must have one, didn't it?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Hm. Even if there were aetheryte shards in the depths of O'Ghomoro, you would have needed to attune yourselves to them before you could identify their signatures within the Lifestream.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Ah, well, that's where yer wrong, love. We had this Sharlayan bloke to help us, see. Delivered us right into Titan's bedchamber, he did.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: I don't rightly know how he did it, but I do remember him sayin' it weren't nothin' any Sharlayan scholar worth her salt couldn't manage.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
...Did he now? Hmph.
Locating a beacon in the absence of a known signature might be possible if the aetherytes in question happened to be... Ah, yes. But in order to guide a traveler to said beacon safely, a second party would be required to... Hmmm.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is possible─in theory at least. Yet I cannot be certain until I try. Plainly, all will depend upon whether or not I am “worth my salt.”

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Oh, you are, lass! Don't you worry about that! Have a bit o' faith in yerself!

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Why don't we all go to Zelma's Run an' take a closer look at the aetheryte? It ain't far─though there's sure to be a few kobolds blockin' the way. Naught ye can't handle, mind!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So this is the aetheryte the Company of Heroes used to gain access to Titan's sanctuary.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Hm. It is as Papalymo speculated.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In its present state, this aetheryte's signal will not be strong enough for our purposes. I may, however, be able to use my own energies to amplify it. Alas, the task will monopolize my attention for the duration.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It seems you will have to proceed without me, Forename. I must needs remain here and supplement this beacon's power, lest you be denied your only path of escape.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Fear not: I will summon the Maelstrom forces stationed nearby to protect us.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: With effort, it is possible that I may be able to stabilize the aetheryte's signal and thereby join you, albeit belatedly. Until such time as I do, you will be on your own.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now...let us see if I am worth my salt.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have located another beacon─one far below the mountain. I can only speculate as to what you will find there, so stint not in your preparation.

dialogue.name: SCAREDKOBOLD
dialogue.text: Look, an overdweller! Yes, yes, an invader from above! SheHe uses our aetherytes against us!

dialogue.name: ANGRYKOBOLD
dialogue.text: SheHe has defiled Titan's sacred sanctuary─trespassed, violated, defiled!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDS
dialogue.text: (-Kobolds-)Overdwellers must leave! Overdwellers must fly!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: Brothers and sisters, fear herhim not! HerHis fate shall be decided by the Lord of Crags!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: Hear me, overdweller! You and your treacherous brethren must be held to account for the breaking of the covenant!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: You shall be first to face judgment! Then Limsa Lominsa and her oathbreakers─liars, betrayers, oathbreakers!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text:
O Great Father, Lord of Crags! Titan, we summon You! Titan, we summon You!
O Great Father, Lord of Crags! Titan, we summon You! Titan, we summon You!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDS
dialogue.text: (-Kobolds-)He is come! He is come! The Lord of Crags, Titan is come!

dialogue.name: TITAN
dialogue.text: Overdweller...art thou deaf to their weeping?

dialogue.name: TITAN
dialogue.text: Thy vile kind coveteth ever the blessing of the land and murdereth my children by the score─all in service to greed. Such sins are beyond pardon.

dialogue.name: TITAN
dialogue.text: Ah...but I am not the first to suffer thy defiance. Thou didst bring Ifrit low.

dialogue.name: TITAN
dialogue.text: Godless overdweller! Thy myriad heresies shall not go unpunished! Upon thee shall I wreak a terrible vengeance!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDS
dialogue.text: (-Kobolds-)The Lord of Crags, Great Father Titan has fallen!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: The crimes of the overdwellers shall never be forgiven! Never be forgotten! No, no, never!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: 'Twas your kin who broke the covenant! We have acted only in defense of our lands!

dialogue.name: ZADA
dialogue.text: Cease your aggression, or never will there be peace! Until our dying breaths, we shall defy you─deny, decry, defy!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Now these are the readings one would expect of an eikon...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: I have seen enough. We proceed as planned.

dialogue.name: RHITAHTYN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Are you sure that is wise, my lord? Your...curiosity is untested and unproven. We do not yet know its true capabilities.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Then trust in mine, Rhitahtyn. My curiosity, as you so eloquently put it, would have bested Titan in the blink of an eye.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Why, if there be truth to the legends, it could readily subjugate the whole of Eorzea given but a little while longer. Is that not so?

dialogue.name: LAHABREAEORZEA
dialogue.text: It is. No greater single power has ever been conceived, much less realized.

dialogue.name: RHITAHTYN
dialogue.text: What you say may well be true. But while such devices may win battles, I do not believe they will serve to change the course of this war.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Oh but they will. Have a little faith, my friend.

dialogue.name: RHITAHTYN
dialogue.text: ...I cannot endorse this course of action.

dialogue.name: LAHABREAANCIENT
dialogue.text: ...Fool.

dialogue.name: LAHABREAANCIENT
dialogue.text: And now shehe has a fourth. Fascinating.

dialogue.name: LAHABREAANCIENT
dialogue.text: Carry on, crystal bearer. Far though you have come, your work is far from done.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And naught remained to mark his passing...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well, the Ascians are nothing if not elusive. It is of little wonder that they should cast advanced teleportation magicks at will.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But that they would choose to consort with the Empire...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: What common goal could they possibly share...?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I feared I might arrive too late, but I see you had the matter well in hand.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have taken measures to ensure that we are not pursued, yet I cannot say how long they will hold.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Take your leave while the kobolds are still in disarray. I will follow anon. There is something I must investigate before I depart.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I will teleport you to the aetheryte in Zelma's Run, and we will rendezvous at Camp Bronze Lake. Agreed?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am relieved to see you well. But come, let us discuss our next step.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I must needs remain here to ensure that you have a means of egress. As I told you, we have no way of knowing what awaits you at the beacon, so be sure to prepare yourself prior to departing.

obj.n: One Swallow Does Not a Victory Make
